name: date_time
description: Parse, validate, manipulate, and format dates and times.

module.name: Parse Date/Time
module.description: This module will parse an input into a structured Date/Time that can be manipulated or formatted. Along with human readable dates, this module can parse 'ISO-8601' standard strings, 'RFC 2822' standard strings, Unix timestamps, and many more formats.

param.description: Input to be parsed into date. Human readable string, 'ISO-8601', 'RFC 2822', Unix Timestamp, or the output of another Parse Date/Time module.
If avalibale supply the locale to help distinguish between date formats in different areas of the world. E.g. American MM/DD/YYYY or European DD/MM/YYYY.
How to offset the date from UTC/Parsed input and by how much.
Define a custom offset in the format of ¬±HH:mm. E.g. Plus eight and a half hours: +08:30
Pick a timezone to calculate the offset. Daylight savings will be included in offset calculation.
Specify a location from a latitude and longitude string separated by a comma (,). Daylight savings will be included in offset calculation. E.g. 47.650499,-122.350070 would be America/Los_Angeles.

module.name: Current Date/Time
module.description: This module will return the current date/time into a structured Date object that can be manipulated or formatted.

param.description: How to offset the date from UTC/Parsed input and by how much.
Define a custom offset in the format of ¬±HH:mm. E.g. Plus eight and a half hours: +08:30
Pick a timezone to calculate the offset. Daylight savings will be included in offset calculation.
Specify a location from a latitude and longitude string separted by a comma (,). Daylight savings will be included in offset calculation. E.g. 47.650499,-122.350070 would be America/Los_Angeles.

module.name: Format Date/Time
module.description: This module will format the output of the Parse Date/Time module to a given human readable form.

param.description: A required input to be formatted into a string. The input can be an 'ISO-8601' formatted string, Unix Timestamp, or the structured Date/Time object output of another Date/Time module.
The format of the returned output. Choose from one of the common options, use Date/Time tokens to create a custom format, or specify another Date/Time object for a relative format.
Using a list of tokens to create a customized format.
A comparison date. If no input is given then the time at execution will be used. A date represented in 'ISO-8601' format, Unix Timestamp, or the output of Parse Date/Time module.

module.name: Round Date/Time
module.description: Return start or end of unit in time of a Date/Time object.

param.description: Round the input to the start or end of the time unit specified.

A required input to be rounded up or down by the specified unit. The input can be an 'ISO-8601' formatted string, Unix Timestamp, or the structured Date/Time object output of another Date/Time module.
The unit of time to round up or down to.
Define the day that at the begining of the week.

module.name: Manipulate Date/Time
module.description: Add or subtract a unit of time from a parsed date object.

param.description: Manipulate the input date by choosing to add, subtract, or set a unit of time.
A required input to be manipulated. The input can be an 'ISO-8601' formatted string, Unix Timestamp, or the structured Date/Time object output of another Date/Time module.
How many years to add or subtract from input date. If using operation, Set, then sets the year (e.g. 2017).
How many months to add or subtract from the input date. If using operation, Set, then sets the month (1 - 12).
How many days to add or subtract from the input date. If using operation, Set, then sets the date of the month.
How many hours to add or subtract from the input date. If using operation, Set, then sets the hour (0 - 23).
How many minutes to add or subtract from the input date. If using operation, Set, then sets the hour (0 - 59).
How many seconds to add or subtract from the input date. If using operation, Set, then sets the hour (0 - 59).
A duration represented as ISO-8601 duration string or the output of the Compare Date/Time module.

module.name: Check Date/Time
module.description: Check an input date against specified conditions and route your template accordingly.

param.description: Date to be checked. A date represented in 'ISO-8601' format, Unix Timestamp, or the output of Parse Date/Time module.
Specify the condition to check input date against.
Add days you wish to check for. E.g. To check if the date lands on a western weekend, add 'Saturday' and 'Sunday'.
A reference date to compare the input date to.
A second reference date to compare the input date to.
If reference dates are considered inclusive then condition will be successful if input date matches a reference date.

module.name: Compare Date/Time
module.description: Compare two parsed date objects resulting in the absolute difference between them.

param.description: A date represented in 'ISO-8601' format, Unix Timestamp, or the output of Parse Date/Time module.
A date represented in 'ISO-8601' format, Unix Timestamp, or the output of Parse Date/Time module.
Add days you wish to Ignore. E.g. To ignore days of a western weekend, add 'Saturday' and 'Sunday'.
If selected, the second input date is included in the calculation. E.g. Monday to Friday would be 5 days instead of 4.
